alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Elmore (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:18AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Elmore and southern Coosa Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1117 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weoka Mills, or 11 miles northwest of Wetumpka, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Speed, Lyle, Pentonville, Dollar, Cottage Grove, Titus, Weoka Mills, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Welona, Moriah, Ten Cedar Estates, Nixburg, Higgins Ferry Park, Jordan Lake, Mitchell Lake, Ray and Hissop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
